intro: Androsace vitaliana subsp. lepontina, commonly known as the Lepontine rock jasmine, is a low-growing perennial plant native to the alpine regions of Europe. It belongs to the family Primulaceae and is characterized by its dense, cushion-like growth habit. The plant produces small, bell-shaped flowers that are typically white or pale pink, blooming in late spring to early summer. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to cold, high-altitude environments. Its foliage consists of narrow, grass-like leaves that are often covered in a fine layer of white hairs.
